subject: Re: [junit] Test coverage metrics reporting tool
msgSnippet: Without parsing the source code there is no way to know. The method getMethods() returns an array of Method objects.  The class Method has a toString() method
messageBody:
Without parsing the source code there is no way to know.

The method getMethods() returns an array of Method objects. The class Method has a toString() method which only returns
the signature information of the method, not the method code.

Mike


Vladimir Bossicard wrote:

> > The class Class has a method getMethods().
>
> BTW does anyone have an idea how to know the number of executable lines
> of a method (without the comments)?
>
> -Vladimir
